title: Gresham Carnegie Library
text:
The Gresham Carnegie Library, is a historic building in <a href="Gresham%2C%20Oregon">Gresham</a>, <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>. The <a href="Tudor%20Revival%20architecture">Tudor</a> style building designed by <a href="Folger%20Johnson">Folger Johnson</a> was built in 1913 and was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in January 2000. It served as a public library in the <a href="Multnomah%20County%20Library">Multnomah County Library</a> system from 1913 until December 1989 when the <a href="Gresham%20Library">Gresham Library</a> opened.
At that time the Gresham Historical Society purchased the building and opened the Gresham History Museum. The building underwent six-months of renovations in 2012.
